What Security Features are Available in Rental Printers?

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

In today’s digital age, data security is more important than ever — especially when it comes to office equipment. If you're asking, what security features are available in rental printers?, you're on the right track. Whether you're a small business or a large organization, understanding the built-in protections of modern rental printers can help safeguard your confidential data and maintain compliance with industry standards.Whether you're renting a basic desktop printer or a high-volume multifunction device (MFD), rental printers today come equipped with multiple security options to protect your documents, networks, and confidential data. This article will walk you through the most essential security features available in rental printers, so you can make a smart and safe decision for your business.

Why Printer Security Matters

Before we dive into the specific features, let’s consider why security matters in printers.

Printers are no longer simple output devices. They are now smart machines — often with storage, internet connectivity, and access to sensitive company data. Without the proper protection, they can become a vulnerable point in your network.

This is especially important if your business handles:

  • Financial reports and invoices

  • Legal or contractual documents

  • Client or patient records

  • Proprietary information or trade secrets

Printer rentals are a cost-effective solution for many companies. But just like owned devices, rented printers must also meet security standards. If you're unfamiliar with how printer rentals work, this guide explains what printer rental is and why it's a popular option.

1. User Authentication and Access Control

One of the primary ways rental printers protect data is through user authentication.

Only authorized users can access printer functions like printing, scanning, or copying. This is commonly done through:

  • PIN codes or passwords

  • ID cards or badges (via card reader)

  • Biometric scanners (fingerprint readers)

This ensures that confidential documents don’t end up in the wrong hands, especially in shared or open office environments.

Benefits:

  • Prevents unauthorized printing

  • Tracks individual user activity

  • Reduces paper and toner waste

2. Secure Print Release

Secure Print Release, also called “pull printing” or “follow-me printing,” holds a print job until the authorized user confirms release at the machine.

Here’s how it works:

  • A user sends a print job from their computer.

  • The job is stored securely in the printer’s memory.

  • The user must log in or scan a card at the device to release the print.

This prevents documents from sitting unclaimed on the output tray — a common source of data leakage.

3. Data Encryption and Secure Storage

Modern rental printers often come with built-in hard drives that store print jobs, scanned files, or job histories. Without proper encryption, this stored data can be accessed if the device is compromised or returned at the end of the lease.

Top security rental printers use:

  • AES 256-bit encryption for stored data

  • Secure erasure features to wipe hard drives clean after use

  • Encrypted data transmission (SSL/TLS) over networks

Before renting, ask your provider if the printer includes these protections.

Tip: Look for a rental provider that includes data sanitization or secure wipe protocols at the end of the rental term. You can learn more about what's typically included in a rental from this guide on printer rental agreements.

4. Network Security and Firewall Integration

Rental printers are often connected to your company’s Wi-Fi or local area network (LAN). That makes them potential access points for hackers or malware.

Fortunately, advanced printers now come with:

  • Built-in firewalls

  • IP filtering to limit access to known devices or networks

  • Automatic firmware updates

  • Intrusion detection systems (IDS)

These features help protect your network from unauthorized access or data breaches via the printer.

5. Secure Scanning and Email Protection

If you regularly scan documents to email or network folders, you’ll want to make sure your rented printer includes secure scan-to-email protocols.

Top security features include:

  • SMTP authentication for email security

  • PDF encryption with password protection

  • Automatic email address filtering to avoid sending to wrong recipients

This is especially critical for industries like healthcare, legal services, and finance.

6. Audit Logs and Activity Tracking

Want to know who printed what, when, and where? Many rental printers offer audit logging features.

These tools can:

  • Track usage by user, department, or machine

  • Provide insights for IT admins or compliance officers

  • Detect abnormal behavior (like bulk printing of sensitive files)

This helps not only with security but also with cost control and accountability.

7. Cloud Printing Security

Many rental printers now support cloud printing platforms like Google Cloud Print, Microsoft Universal Print, or third-party apps.

To keep cloud printing secure, make sure your rental printer:

  • Requires authentication before sending to cloud

  • Uses SSL/TLS encryption

  • Offers admin controls for cloud-based access

Cloud printing is convenient — especially for remote or hybrid teams — but only if done securely.

8. Security Certifications and Compliance

When choosing a rental printer, look for security-certified models. Some key standards include:

  • Common Criteria Certification (ISO/IEC 15408)

  • FIPS 140-2 for encryption modules

  • HIPAA or GDPR compliance (for regulated industries)

Ask your rental provider what certifications are supported. This ensures your device meets both local and international standards.

9. End-of-Lease Data Protection

Here’s something many businesses overlook: What happens to your data when the rental ends?

Your provider should guarantee:

  • Full data wipe of internal storage

  • Removal of cached files or job logs

  • Certificate of data destruction if requested

This should be part of your rental agreement. Curious about how long rentals typically last? Check out this post on rental durations for common terms.

How to Choose the Right Secure Rental Printer

Here are a few questions to guide your selection:

  1. What kind of data will be printed or scanned?

  2. Do you need user authentication (e.g., for large offices)?

  3. Is your network protected by firewalls and monitoring tools?

  4. Will documents be sent via email or cloud apps?

  5. Does the rental include data destruction services?

If you're still exploring your options, this helpful guide on printer types explains which models are best for different business needs.

Final Thoughts

So, what security features are available in rental printers? From secure printing and encryption to access controls and compliance certifications, there are many tools available to help protect your business data.

Don’t settle for the cheapest printer. Instead, choose a rental provider who understands the importance of security and can walk you through available features. The extra protection is worth it — for your peace of mind, your clients’ trust, and your business’s integrity.

Looking to understand pricing? This breakdown of printer rental costs will help you budget wisely while keeping security in mind.
